Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi all.

The Royal Library=92s curator team are in the moment analyzing cra=
wl logs and extractor modules.
Their results have shown that Heritrix extra=
ctors are very easy to produce false-positive URIs (known issue!).

For exa=
mple looking through our last snapshot harvest crawllog after extracted mim=
e-types, we found over 1 mill false-positive URIs (only looking through 200=
, 404 status code).
The biggest problem is not our 404 pages, but 200 pages=
 that crawlers continue on harvesting.

We see this very often when the pag=
e refers to self generated 404 pages and the URIs are not validated and doe=
sn=92t respond with 404. These URIs again generates even more false-positiv=
es.

The important place in the ExtractorJS class is when the method UriUti=
ls.isVeryLikelyUri() is called.
How well does this work in your crawls rega=
rding the number of false positives being accepted?

Another matter is the =
use of the JAVASCRIPT_STRING_EXTRACTOR to find candidate urls:

We consider=
 just matching URIs between quotes could be too simple and to generate too =
much noise.

Have anyone tried to create an even better regexp?
If this is =
not possible could an option be to match other things like src=3D=94 =94, h=
ref=3D=94 =94 between quotes etc.

The curator team will continue the analy=
zing process, but if any of you have an idea or a solution please share if =
possible.

Thanks.

Best regards,


S=F8ren V. Carlsen (on behalf of the cu=
rators at Netarkivet)

--_000_C4C76BFAD99C1E41A39A14996ED46BEA015C51AFB2EXCHANGE02kbd_
